newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Bank of Ireland raises variable rates.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Ireland raises variable rates.

text.p: Bank of Ireland said on Thursday that it was raising its variable lending and deposit rates with effect from close of business on May 9.
The bank will increase its standard variable mortgage rate by 40 basis points, it said in a statement.
The move follows the Irish central bank's decision to raise the official Short Term Facility Rate (STF) by 50 basis points on May 1.
A number of other lending institutions, including Irish Permanent, Allied Irish Banks and First National Building Society, have already raised their rates.
